title.narrative: COVID 19 RESPONSE FOR SOCIAL INCLUSION

description.narrative: Children and adolescents, as well as their families and caregivers, in homes and institutions access critical evidence, communications and social protection policies that aim to reduce the possibility of COVID-19 transmission and its impact on the realization of children's rights and their best interests., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Private Sector Engagement, Private Sector Engagement (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents, as well as their families and caregivers, in homes and institutions access critical evidence,communications and social protection policies that aim to reduce the possibility of COVID-19 transmission and its impact on therealization of children?s rights and their best interests.

description.narrative: UNICEF reduced the possibility of COVID-19 transmission and acted towards the protection of the most vulnerable children from the impact of COVID-19 by supporting rapid and sustained analyses and monitoring on the impact of COVID-19 on children wellbeing, mobilizing key influencers, mass media and responders across all pillars to rapidly disseminate accurate and;updated information and advocating on key issues as the importance of vaccination, hygiene and prevention good practices and;safe return to schools.; Hygiene kits were also delivered to the most vulnerable migrant children, adolescents, and women, in order to promote healthy IPC habits.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
